meanings.definition: Showing or having an extreme and uncontrollable passion or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: She was a rabid fan of the band, attending every concert.
meanings.sent2: The rabid supporters cheered loudly for their team.
meanings.sent3: His rabid love for chocolate led to a pantry full of sweets.
meanings.sent4: The rabid excitement in the air was palpable.
meanings.sent5: Her rabid dedication to her work was truly inspiring.

meanings.sent1: The rabid dog was foaming at the mouth.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian had to handle a rabid animal carefully.
meanings.sent3: The rabid squirrel caused chaos in the park.
meanings.sent4: The rabid raccoon was a danger to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The rabid cat had to be quarantined for safety.

meanings.sent1: The rabid criminal was finally apprehended by the police.
meanings.sent2: The rabid dog growled menacingly at anyone who approached.
meanings.sent3: The rabid storm tore through the town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent4: The rabid competition between the two teams led to a heated match.
meanings.sent5: His rabid temper often got him into trouble.
